data.text:
@BioTurboNick The rate of increase of BA.2 looks to be declining as well, which one would expect over time with more prior infections and booster shots on the margins.

It would not surprise me if the number of BA.2 confirmed cases in the USA tops off under 10,000/day late March then declines.

@BioTurboNick No doubt, but extrapolating the increasing percentage of BA.2 cases to a RAPIDLY declining overall confirmed case count week-over-week suggests while BA.2 cases may be trickling up on an absolute level nationally, there are not likely more than roughly 6,000/day confirmed.
@BioTurboNick @BiobotAnalytics Thanks for sharing, I appreciate the info and explanations you share ❤️
@BioTurboNick @BiobotAnalytics You think we see a ba.2 surge
@BioTurboNick @BiobotAnalytics Why are we even tracking BA.2 separately anyway, seems like it should just be rolled into Omicron
@BioTurboNick I will agree to fuck off but I'll take that view to my grave, sir.
@BioTurboNick 🤣🤣🤣 Right there with you at this point.
@NotALegume "Don't show any graph more complicated than a 3rd grader can understand" is certainly a position, but not one I intend to follow.
@NotALegume They aren't misleading if you know how to read them, fuck off.
